comment.body:
@Alex-302 
The rule `||bilibili.com^$removeparam=mid` in commit [1ea2772 ](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1ea2772c9c7dc5df85b49161f878542279016ee3) may cause failures when opening any `space.bilibili.com` pages.
At least the following two requests are affected:
- `https://api.bilibili.com/x/space/wbi/acc/info`
- `https://api.bilibili.com/x/space/setting`

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://cdn.youtubeunblocked.live/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.youtubeunblocked.live%2F) ### Comment > When I visit a website and select YouTube from the quick links, sometimes when I’m browsing videos, channels, or the top page, clicking on links will open them in a new tab instead of the same one. When I check the original tab, an ad site has opened there. The destinations vary, but the original URL is as follows: > ``` > https://p23hxejm1.com//CPR/CPR.php?c=1843194 > ``` > > And there is the list of redirects > ``` > https://vpn-center.com/cdu/ww/index.php?p1=https://click.vpn-center.com&p2=https://click.vpn-center.com/click&zoneid=1843194&connection_type=other > > https://gamdom.com/?utm_source=propellerads&utm_medium=paid > > https://ak.ptailadsol.net/4/6280799 > > https://v.qiepian.vip/a/?code=QOgz0kM0WK > > https://p23hxejm1.com/r/dir?zoneid=1843194&pb=8a5ed67ac74da11ec8711dc92c75d4171724251476&psp=aosbZquUoWnIMKmW2g3EjoVTVurHhQbkoR_x36SXMNAJl4LdUHjzlpUobaWL5MWfSuUMi8GUMGDdd-TEOgc5XzsrL7rpgT565lDRcNwSjxdnQW9dRv-W-GoWr18_mMaJYUXWcPMdS0Y1IzV-cs2Kf66k-PBRNz5U6D0mLL9O1N55FnUTlCKgHUsyqwEUvIXQca-xToo2c4pLLvt2dXoWhjPv9AHiEt1djfPKrC_un9c5XUzWnSnzW_1avatabFnUMqrLok9fM3zm60C_E52rzYCfJRRX-zBUXCOxb8CNXpectOwyzVsQcoYgGk7idd0zjitvEoOwBJdk7rJeGgkU1BP6245obf1BluOC6smxo5ltrGxKLQ==&fdl=1&nojs=0&abvar=0&febuild=1.0.314&t=1&wcks=1&wgl=1&cnvs=1&os=-540 > > https://fulliosdefense.com/landers/valid-vpn/lp11/index.php?lpkey=1701240627f2567738 > ``` > > I don't think you can access it anymore since it has expired, but when I look at my browser history, I can see that I was redirected from this URL. > > ``` > https://208.87.241.75/channel/UCsBoll12QILGTkmQ4PSttkw?__cpo=aHR0cHM6Ly9tLnlvdXR1YmUuY29t > ``` > > > https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/186904 > > ### Screenshots

comment.body:
`||p23hxejm1.com^$all` blocks access as expected, but the tab still opens.  
`#%#//scriptlet('json-prune', 'default')` doesn’t seem to work, as the ad tab still opens. I’ve attached the HAR file from when I tested this rule.  
[json-prune.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17055489/json-prune.zip)

`#%#//scriptlet("prevent-addEventListener", "click", ")]=this[_0x")` also didn’t work, and the ad tab still opens. I’ve attached the HAR file from that test as well.  
[prevent-addEventListener.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17055491/prevent-addEventListener.zip)

Additionally, a new ad server seems to have appeared. The existing rule `.com/api/users*^pii=&in=false^$document` blocks access, but the tab still opens. I’ve attached the HAR file from testing that rule as well.
 [new_ad.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17055507/new_ad.zip)

There is no rule to hide the ad placeholders. On PCs, blocking the script results in a size of zero. However, on iPhones, because the iframe remains, it's natural that the ad frame does not disappear. This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: blog.esuteru.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock professional company.
Ad-Shield receives up to 700 000 000 KRW per 2 year from tech foundation support program of South Korean government.

These records can be verified at [here](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues?q=label%3Aad-shield+).
You can check the fact that support of South Korean government at [here](https://www.venturesquare.net/857777).

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).


## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/166924) if other issue.

comment.body:
> Is my understanding correct that "conflict" means a conflict with other extensions?

No, generally speaking, scriptlet sometimes does not work reliably and this is particularly salient on iOS. But we can't say for sure as we can't debug your device.

comment.body:
> @Alex-302 The rule `||bilibili.com^$removeparam=mid` in commit [1ea2772 ](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1ea2772c9c7dc5df85b49161f878542279016ee3) may cause failures when opening any `space.bilibili.com` pages. At least the following two requests are affected:
> 
> * `https://api.bilibili.com/x/space/wbi/acc/info`
> * `https://api.bilibili.com/x/space/setting`

Can confirm, adding `@@||bilibili.com^$removeparam=mid` in custom filters fixed it.

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock professional company.
Ad-Shield receives up to 700 000 000 KRW per 2 year from tech foundation support program of South Korean government.

These records can be verified at [here](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues?q=label%3Aad-shield+).
You can check the fact that support of South Korean government at [here](https://www.venturesquare.net/857777).

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).


## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/166924) if other issue.
